data.title: B.O.M.D.
data.meta_description: "B.O.M.D.", is the third track and the second collaboration betweeen Clairo & Danny L Harle of her debut extended play, diary 001, it was released on May 25th, 2018. Clairo used the release "B.O.M.D.", to come out as bisexual on Twitter, stating on May 28th, 2018, "B.O.M.D." is also G.O.M.D, for...
data.text:
"B.O.M.D.", is the third track and the second collaboration betweeen Clairo & Danny L Harle of her debut extended play, diary 001, it was released on May 25th, 2018.

Background[]

Clairo used the release "B.O.M.D.", to come out as bisexual on Twitter, stating on May 28th, 2018, "B.O.M.D." is also G.O.M.D, for ur information", meaning "girl of my dreams".[1]

Theme[]

The song is about the theme of anxiety and social pressure in romantic relationships. "B.O.M.D." is an acronym for "Boy of My Dreams".

In the song, Clairo expresses her insecurities and fears within a relationship. She talks about the pressure to live up to the expectations of being the perfect partner and the fear of losing the boy of her dreams. The lyrics reflect a sense of anxiety and vulnerability, as well as the struggle to maintain a relationship despite doubts and fears.

The song also addresses the idea of idealizing a person and how it can affect expectations within a relationship. Clairo sings about how she sometimes feels incapable of meeting those expectations and how it can generate insecurities.

"B.O.M.D." is an emotive and honest song that showcases Clairo's vulnerability in the realm of romance.

Lyrics[]

{{{lyrics}}}

Trivia[]

This is the song where Clairo reveals that she is Bisexual.

This is the second song with a collaboration, the first is Hello?, with Rejjie Snow.
